radiographic_examinations.findings: Atherosclerotic vessel wall changes in both temporal arteries. Perivascular hypoechoic halo noted around both superficial temporal arteries, more on the right than the left.
Failed to reveal any characteristic features in the brain, brain stem, and neck.
No narrowing, aneurysm, malformations, dissections, or other significant abnormalities in neck vessels and the circle of Willis.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Biopsy of the right superficial temporal artery
radiographic_examinations.findings: Narrow lumen with hyperplastic intima layer, focal disruption and fragmentation of the internal elastic lamina, marked thickening of the tunica media with multiple ill-formed granulomas composed of epithelioid cells, lymphocytes, and multinucleated giant cells. Multiple congested blood vessels, edema, and transmural inflammatory cell inflammation.
